newsitem.title: USA: TABLE - CABLEVISION Q2 SHR LOSS $5.18.
newsitem.headline: TABLE - CABLEVISION Q2 SHR LOSS $5.18.

text.p: NOTE: Net figures above were net losses applicable to common shareholders, after preferred dividend requirements.

The second-quarter results do not reflect the pending transactions with Fox/Liberty, whereby Fox/Liberty would obtain an ownership interest in several sports programming businesses of Rainbow Media and Madison Square Garden LP for an investment of $850 million.

Also not reflected is the agreement to acquire 10 cable television systems serving 820,000 subscribers in New York and New Jersey from Tele-Communications Inc for approximately 12.2 million newly issued shares of the company's common stock and the assumption of $669 million in debt.

As of June 30, 1997, the company served approximately 2,560,000 subscribers on a consolidated basis, reflecting acquisitions (adding 57,000 subscribers) and a gain of approximately 58,000 subscribers (2.4 percent) from internal growth during the first six months of 1997.
Recurring average monthly revenue per subscriber was $39.18 in June 1997, as compared to $36.71 in December 1996.
Full company name is Cablevision Systems Corp.
